title.jp: I'm Doremi! I'm a Witch Apprentice

synopsis: Doremi Harukaze comes across a magic shop and calls out the owner, Majorika, for being a witch, turning the latter into a witch frog. Now, she must become a witch apprentice herself to return Majorika to her normal self.
Doremi and her best friend Hazuki Fujiwara want to swap lives for a day, as they both feel that the other is luckier. However, this leads to a few consequences.

title.jp: The Transfer Student from Naniwa! Aiko Debuts

synopsis: A new girl named Aiko Senōō from Osaka transfers to Doremi's class and unintentionally upsets Doremi and Hazuki at first. Once Doremi gets to know her, she befriends her and tries to find ways to cheer her up on Parents' Day at school.

title.jp: It's Not Scary If We're All Witches

synopsis: Hazuki and Aiko find out Doremi's secret of being a witch apprentice after the stunt she pulls on Parents' Day, so they must also become witch apprentices to protect Doremi. The three girls redecorate the magic shop with a more cheerful design after Doremi accidentally destroys the shop.
After fixing up the magic shop and dubbing it Mahōdō, the girls await their first customers and are visited by a singing witch wholesaler Dela.
Nobuko Yokokawa is a liar in the girls' class, but nevertheless amuses everyone with her imaginative stories. When Aiko believes in her and realizes she lied, she becomes very hurt.

The three girls prepare to take their first witch exam, but Doremi must spend the day supervising her younger sister Pop. Pop wants to go to her grandparent's house by train by herself. When it comes to exam time, Hazuki and Aiko earn fairies for passing the exam. Doremi fails the exam, so she doesn't get a fairy.

After failing to pass the level 9 exam, Doremi is given another chance. Her goal is to find medicine for Motamota. Luckily, Doremi passes and gets her fairy, but she does it with the help of Aiko and Hazuki, who come to see her out of worry.

title.jp: Where Did You Go!? Fairy Dodo

synopsis: Doremi's fairy Dodo runs off after being scolded, so the girls use their new magic spell, Magical Stage, to try and find her.
Miss Seki and the vice principal drop by the magic shop after photos of the girls working there arise.

title.jp: Early Riser Girl Marina And A Bouquet from the Heart

synopsis: After being insulted by Takao Kimura, Marina Koizumi refuses to take care of the school's flowers. Hazuki is determined to help Marina realize Kimura is remorseful.

title.jp: A Wish For A Precious Shirt

synopsis: A young boy named Misaki Shibayama trades in his favorite shirt to get a charm to help his older brother Daichi play in a soccer game.
The girls take the Level 8 Exam in which they have three hours to clear three obstacles unknowingly chosen beforehand.
Naomi Okuyama is insulted by the SOS Trio for showing her feminine side and refuses to forgive them until they make her laugh.
Majorika gets purchased by Pop. Pop treats Majorika like a plush toy and she takes her to school one day.
Doremi's father takes her and her friends on a fishing trip with a young boy who shares his passion.

Masaru Yada gets arrested, and no one else besides Hazuki and Miss Seki believes that he did nothing wrong. With Miss Seki's job on the line, Doremi, Hazuki and Aiko use their magic to find out if the rumors behind Yada are true.

title.jp: Don't Use That! The Forbidden Magic

synopsis: After a fluke grants them immediate success on the Level 7 Exam, the girls find out that Nanako Okada refuses to take care of the school's rabbits and use their new powers to find out why. They learn that Nanako once lost her puppy and is afraid to have another pet because she thinks the same thing might happen.
On the last day without magic for breaking the laws of the Witch World, Hazuki is kidnapped by two conmen and only Doremi and Aiko can rescue her.

title.jp: The Rival Makes Her Appearnce! The Mahō-dōu is in Big Trouble!!

synopsis: Majorika loses her shop to Dela in a card game, and her arch-rival Majoruka takes over.

title.jp: Majo Ruka's Goods are Filled with Danger

synopsis: After noticing that the people around them are becoming ill due to Majoruka's charms, Aiko, Doremi, and Hazuki use their magic to break the spell.

title.jp: The Road to the Level 6 Witch is Long!?

synopsis: With the shop under enemy control, the girls must find a way to get in to take their Level 6 Exam.

After her father gives Aiko a new harmonica and decides to throw away the old, cherished one, she runs off to Hazuki's house. There, they find an extra magic bead, which they use to gain entrance to their exam.
The girls get a hold of Majoruka's crystal ball and are challenged to a magical duel for control of the shop.

Pop is appointed as a witch apprentice after witnessing her sister and friends perform magic. She uses magic to create ghosts at her kindergarten sleepover, and Doremi, Hazuki, and Aiko help clean up her mess.

When returning the injured Kanae Īda to her father's steak shop, Doremi and the others discover the pall of bad luck covering the place and set out to uncover the mystery. They are appointed as Pureleine by the Queen to capture Bad Cards, as they have hearts pure enough to be able to do so.

The girls receive the Purelein Personal Computer from the Queen to capture the Bad Cards that exist in the Human World. Upon start-up, they are introduced to Oyajīde, the captive wizard who let loose the cards.

title.jp: Love is a Windy Ride Over a Plateau

synopsis: Doremi comes across a cute tennis player named Yutaka Kashiwag at Hazuki's summer house and falls head over heels for him, but her snobby classmate Reika Tamaki also has an eye on him.

title.jp: The Tap Disappeared at the Festival!

synopsis: Doremi accidentally loses her tap at the Summer Festival.

title.jp: I Want to Meet the Ghost!

synopsis: Doremi, Hazuki, Aiko, and their classmates head to Nobuaki Yamauchi's temple to share ghost stories and test their courage.
Upon returning to school from summer vacation, the girls become interested in their classmate Shino Hanada's trip to Mongolia. At the same time, they are due to take the Level 5 Exam.

title.jp: Defeat Tamaki! The Class President Election

synopsis: Masaharu Miyamoto, with the support of Doremi and her friends, challenges Tamaki's bid for class president.

title.jp: Much Panic at the Athletic Meet!

synopsis: It's the day of the school's Sports Festival, but trouble begins to plague the events.

title.jp: I Want to See My Mother!

synopsis: Aiko's mother comes to visit, but she is unable to face her daughter. Upon finding out, Aiko heads to her mother's house in Hannan City to meet her.

title.jp: The Transfer Student is a Witch Apprentice!?

synopsis: The famous pop star and child actress Onpu Segawa becomes the new student in class. After a local audition, the girls find out that she is a witch apprentice under Majoruka.
For the Level 4 Exam, the witch apprentices must race the Witch World's fastest hare and tortoise through an obstacle course.
An intense storm in the Witch World blows a group of magic frogs into the Human World, and the girls must return them before anyone finds out.

title.jp: Ryōta and the Monster of the Night

synopsis: Ryōta Hayashi is obsessed with monsters, specifically Gazamadon, and everyone scolds him for it. He becomes so upset, he puts all his monster goods away.

title.jp: Doremi's Boyfriend is a Middle School Student!

synopsis: When Maki Higuchi's brother in middle school, Shūzou Higuchi, sees Onpu in her witch apprentice outfit, she uses her magic to make him fall in love with someone else, which turns out to be Doremi.

title.jp: Doremi Wins Easily? The Level 3 Exam

synopsis: The girls go to take the Level 3 Exam, hoping to pass so they can be granted each a seedling that eventually sprouts into a tree and yields an endless supply of magic spheres. Surprisingly, the exam is one they will have to take separately. They each must pass through a door into their own world to encounter a series of events that will test their own individual strengths and are only allowed to use magic twice. The girls also must also complete the exam in one hour or else they will fail.

title.jp: Father and Son, the Move Towards Victory!

synopsis: Shōta Taniyama loves the game shogi and is able to defeat the vice-principal, but his parents are against his desire to play. With the help of Miss Seki, they allow him to play in an upcoming tournament. Taniyama makes it to the final round but becomes nervous whenever he touches a certain piece. Doremi, Hazuki, and Aiko use this clue to identify the presence of a Bad Card.
Kōta Amano, a boy obsessed with hero shows, is challenged to a fight by an upperclassman, who mistakenly believes he is dating Onpu.

title.jp: Tearful Memories of Papa and the Fireworks

synopsis: Tamaki decides to run away after thinking her father doesn't care because he never punishes her. She is accompanied by Shiori Nakayama, who has been out of school due to illness and also has problems with her father.

title.jp: I Want to Be a Female Pro Wrestler!

synopsis: Mutsumi Kudō, the strongest fighter in class, looks up to professional wrestler Candy Itō but becomes disappointed when she announces a possible retirement.
An ailing Santa Claus enlists the help of Doremi and the girls to deliver presents.
The girls help Michiaki Watabe with his magic show when his father is unable to. For the Level 2 Exam, Doremi and friends are given the task of entertaining a group of witches at a talent show.
Aiko's father's boss arranges a meeting with his daughter Midori for a possible marriage, but Aiko is not ready for another mother.

title.jp: Onpu's E-Mail was a Love Letter?

synopsis: Gōji Nakata becomes one of the many victims of a prank e-mail sent by Hehe asking for a date with Onpu.

title.jp: I Want to Meet Papa! The Dream Placed on the Overnight Express

synopsis: Onpu's father, whom Onpu hasn't seen in six months, is conducting a new express train. So, she tries to get through her audition to meet him before he leaves again.
The Level 1 Exam gives the girls the task of using magic to help someone and receiving thanks. However, things take a turn for the worse when their secret is discovered and spread around town.

Onpu uses her magic to make everyone forget about what they discovered but is punished into a hundred-year sleep because of it. Doremi, Hazuki, and Aiko must decide if they will give up being witches to save their friend.
